snippet: Proposed legislation aims to treat prostitutes as exploited and abused victims rather than as criminals.
abstract: Editorial welcomes anti-prostitution law passed by the French Parliament that will bring the country in line with a growing consensus that it makes better sense to treat prostitutes as victims rather than as criminals; maintains exploitation of sex workers in increasingly true in Europe with increase in trafficking of foreign women, including underage girls, to work in foreign countries.
lead_paragraph: Proposed legislation aims to treat prostitutes as exploited and abused victims rather than as criminals.

headline.main: France’s New Approach to Curbing Prostitution
headline.print_headline: France’s New Approach to Curbing Prostitution
